questions.question: What is the procedure if unable to continue in accordance with your clearance on the NAT OTS?
options: Attempt to obtain a re-clearance, but if unable turn to take up a track offset by 1 or 2 nautical miles to the right and climb/descend 500 ft
Immediately climb to above FL410 or descend to below FL290
Turn to take up a track offset by 500 NM and climb or descend 15 ft
Turn to take up a track offset by 15 NM and climb/descend 500 ft
questions.solution: Turn to take up a track offset by 15 NM and climb/descend 500 ft

questions.question: What is the procedure for loss of HF comms on the North Atlantic?
options: Continue in accordance with flight plan or, if cleared to do something else immediately return to flight plan route
Turn to take up a track offset by 15 NM from track, and climb/descend 500 ft
Continue in accordance with your last acknowledged clearance
questions.solution: Continue in accordance with your last acknowledged clearance

questions.question: What specifically must be checked prior to oceanic flight?
Over the North Atlantic, outside the times of the OTS which of the following aircraft would be on the correct FL?
What information must a pilot give when calling for oceanic clearance?
options: Time of entry, FL and type of aircraft
FL requested and maximum attainable FL
questions.solution: FL requested and maximum attainable FL
